Package neuralnet

Class GeneticAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
neuralnet.GeneticAlgorithm
public class GeneticAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
Genetic algorithm that adapt a network structure to solve a problem. genetic algorithm inspired by neat AI algorithm
Version:
1.1
Author:
PhysicDev

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    float threshold
    threshold value indicate how similar two network must be to be in the same species

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void forceSpeciate​(int SpeciesArrayAmount)
    not very useful, personally i don't use it.
    float getAdjustedFitness()
    return the average adjusted fitness of the whole population.
    the adjusted fitness is the fitness divide by the amount of network in the network's species.
    NeuronNetwork getBest()
    return a copy of the best network in the actual population
    float getBestFitness()
    return the fitness of the best network in the actual population
    i.e. max(getFitnessArray())
    int getDiversity()
    return the amount of species
    float getFitness()
    return the average fitness of the whole population
    float[] getFitnessArray()
    return the fitness of every network in the population in a float array[]
    int getGen()
    return the actual generation.
    int getImprovementLimit()
    the maximum number of generation a species can live without progressing if a species doesn't do any progress within this amount of generation.
    int getInput()  
    int getOutput()  
    int getPop()
    return the amount of network per generation
    int getSpeciesTarget()
    the wanted amount of species is not always the amount of species that we get by generation but the threshold value is change every generation to get closer to that amount of species.
    java.lang.String infoSpeciesArray()
    give info about every species with all the network in the species
    java.lang.String infoSpeciesArrayShort()
    same as infoSpeciesArray() but without the network info

    void nextGen()
    compute the next generation of neuralNetwork
    void setImprovementLimit​(int IL)
    to change the maximum number of generation a species can live without progressing
    void setRandom​(java.util.Random r)
    use this method to set a custom random variable to the genetic algorithm, this variable control everything that is randomly generated in the network.
    void setSpeciesTarget​(int SpeciesTarget)
    to change the wanted amount of species
    void speciate()
    Speciate the population ie distribute the network in category depending of their similarities.
    void speciate​(float threshold)
    Speciate the population ie distribute the network in category depending of their similarities.
    void tests​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target)
    test all neuralNetwork (evaluate their fitness) then update the species update (you must call this method before using nextGen)
    java.lang.String toString()  
    void train​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target, int testCycle)
    do the same as above except it also train the network (so the algorithm don't wander randomly to find good weights through generation and can learn a bit with time)

      public float threshold

      Since:

  • Constructor Details

    • GeneticAlgorithm

      public GeneticAlgorithm​(int Pop, int In, int[] Hid, int Out, float Integrity)
      generate the first generation of the genetic algorithm.
      Parameters:
      Pop - the amount of network by generation
      In - the network number of input
      Hid - the network hidden structure (fully connected)
      Out - the network number of output
      Integrity - the amount of connection kept from the fully connected network associated to this structure
      Since:
      1.1
      See Also:
      GeneticAlgorithm(int, int[]), GeneticAlgorithm(int, int[], float), GeneticAlgorithm(int, int, int[], int)

    • GeneticAlgorithm

      public GeneticAlgorithm​(int Pop, int[] Structure, float Integrity)
      generate the first generation of the genetic algorithm.
      Parameters:
      Pop - the amount of network by generation
      Structure - the Structure of the network (fully connected)
      Integrity - the amount of connection kept from the fully connected network associated to this structure
      Since:
      1.1
      See Also:
      GeneticAlgorithm(int, int[]), GeneticAlgorithm(int, int, int[], int), GeneticAlgorithm(int, int, int[], int, float)

      Since:

      Returns:
      the amount of network per generation
      Since:

    • setRandom

      public void setRandom​(java.util.Random r)
      use this method to set a custom random variable to the genetic algorithm, this variable control everything that is randomly generated in the network.
      Parameters:
      r - the random variable
      Since:
      1.1

    • getFitness

      public float getFitness()
      return the average fitness of the whole population
      Returns:
      the average fitness
      Since:
      1.1

    • getFitnessArray

      public float[] getFitnessArray()
      return the fitness of every network in the population in a float array[]
      Returns:
      the fitness of every network
      Since:
      1.1

    • getBestFitness

      public float getBestFitness()
      return the fitness of the best network in the actual population
      i.e. max(getFitnessArray())
      Returns:
      the fitness of the best network
      Since:
      1.1

    • getBest

      public NeuronNetwork getBest()
      return a copy of the best network in the actual population
      Returns:
      the best network of this generation
      Since:
      1.1

    • getAdjustedFitness

      public float getAdjustedFitness()
      return the average adjusted fitness of the whole population.
      the adjusted fitness is the fitness divide by the amount of network in the network's species. this fitness is used to prevent a species to crush the other.
      Returns:
      the average adjusted fitness
      Since:
      1.1

    • getSpeciesTarget

      public int getSpeciesTarget()
      the wanted amount of species is not always the amount of species that we get by generation but the threshold value is change every generation to get closer to that amount of species.
      Returns:

    • setSpeciesTarget

      public void setSpeciesTarget​(int SpeciesTarget) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      to change the wanted amount of species
      Parameters:
      SpeciesTarget - the wanted amount of species
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if SpceciesTarget is negative or null

    • getImprovementLimit

      public int getImprovementLimit()
      the maximum number of generation a species can live without progressing if a species doesn't do any progress within this amount of generation. it's deleted and replace with new network.
      Returns:
      the improvement limit

    • setImprovementLimit

      public void setImprovementLimit​(int IL) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      to change the maximum number of generation a species can live without progressing
      Parameters:
      IL - the maximum number of generation a species can live without progressing
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if IL is negative or null

    • getDiversity

      public int getDiversity()
      return the amount of species
      Returns:
      the amount of species

    • getInput

      public int getInput()
      Returns:
      the input size of the network

    • getOutput

      public int getOutput()
      Returns:
      the output size of the network

    • speciate

      public void speciate()
      Speciate the population ie distribute the network in category depending of their similarities.
      See Also:
      speciate(), speciate(float), forceSpeciate(int)

    • speciate

      public void speciate​(float threshold)
      Speciate the population ie distribute the network in category depending of their similarities.
      Parameters:
      threshold - indicate how similar two network must be to be in the same species

    • forceSpeciate

      public void forceSpeciate​(int SpeciesArrayAmount)
      not very useful, personally i don't use it. take random Neural Networks to be the reference of their SpeciesArray then sort the remaining Neural Network in the SpeciesArray that is the closest to him (using the compare function on the reference)
      Parameters:
      SpeciesArrayAmount - the wanted number of species

    • nextGen

      public void nextGen()
      compute the next generation of neuralNetwork

    • tests

      public void tests​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target)
      test all neuralNetwork (evaluate their fitness) then update the species update (you must call this method before using nextGen)
      Parameters:
      data - the database of tests
      target - the wanted result value for this tests

    • train

      public void train​(java.util.ArrayList<float[]> data, java.util.ArrayList<float[]> target, int testCycle)
      do the same as above except it also train the network (so the algorithm don't wander randomly to find good weights through generation and can learn a bit with time)
      Parameters:
      data - the database of tests
      target - the wanted result value for this tests
      testCycle - number of tests (the total number of test is S*testCycle where S is the size of the database of tests)

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a compact string representation of the genetic algorithm

    • longInfo

      public java.lang.String longInfo()
      Returns:
      a string representation of the genetic algorithm with every neural network in the actual generation

    • infoSpeciesArray

      public java.lang.String infoSpeciesArray()
      give info about every species with all the network in the species
      Returns:
      info about every species with all the network in the species

    • infoSpeciesArrayShort

      public java.lang.String infoSpeciesArrayShort()
      same as infoSpeciesArray() but without the network info
      Returns:
      info about the species
